profileAlternative.name: Rakesh Adhikesavan
profileAlternative.headline: Python Developer at Nielsen
profileAlternative.summary:
In a world of "Alternative Facts", my objective is to leverage my quantitative skill set to answer questions backed up by science and real data.

About me:
I am a technophile. I love gadgets and eagerly read about the next generation of technologies that will change our lives, perhaps to a degree and in a direction that is yet to be imagined.
I am an animal lover, but my heart belongs to my dog friends.
I love traveling because I enjoy exploring nature, trying new food and meeting people from different cultural backgrounds.

positions.title: Python Developer
positions.description:
Writing Python Code that automates manual processes.

Working with a creative and innovative team to build a Data Analytics platform that leverages the power of Spark, AWS, and other powerful tools.

positions.title: Python Developer
positions.description: Worked on designing and programming a Data Ingestion Engine

positions.title: Illinois Institute of Technology
positions.description:
working with IIT's Office of Institutional Advancement to help the Alumni Relations team to effectively reach out to donors.
Key components of the project include:
- Getting and cleaning data from alumni database
- Creating interactive visualizations using Tableau to understand donation patterns and gain key insights
- Using custom statistical models to find predictors of future major givers
- Defining metrics to aid in Resource Allocation planning and to increase Return on Investment
…
see more

educations.title: Padma Seshadri Bala Bhavan Senior Secondary School

given.text:
Rakesh completed his data science practicum capstone project during summer 2016 in the Office of Institutional Advancement at Illinois Tech. Although a newcomer to philanthropy and advancement, Rakesh made a significant contribution through his analyses of our phonathon program. He used Tableau to create interactive visualizations and dashboards that enabled the manager of our Phonathon program to quickly assess callers'; completion rates and solicitation success. With this kind of real-time analysis, the manager is able to identify callers who might benefit from more training. Rakesh also used Python to clean and structure all the data before visualizing it. He also visualized acquisition, retention and reacquisition trends and developed a basic predictive analysis model that predicts retention.
…
See more

As a student, I found Rakesh to be smart and hard-working, able to find creative solutions to difficult problems. In my experience he works well with clients, and is quite good at helping clients to figure out what sorts of data analytics or visualizations will actually help them.
